intro: Poa pratensis subsp. mucronata, commonly known as the shortawned meadow grass, is a perennial grass species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, bluish-green leaves. The inflorescence consists of a single, dense spike that is usually shorter than the leaf blades. This subspecies is often found in moist meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it an important component of grassland ecosystems and a valuable forage plant.
